clinical_study.brief_title: Determination of the Nature of the Endogenous Ligand of TREM-1 and Its Use as a New Diagnostic Biomarker in Sepsis

brief_summary.textblock: Step 1: Identification and characterisation of the TREM1L protein from samples already available characterised at the hospital Central of Nancy Step 2: Study of the isoforms of TREM1L in correlation with the prognosis of sepsis, Step 3: implementation of assay methods for TREM1L (ELISA or SUPRA MS) Step 4: Validation of assays for TREM1L and its isoforms in a larger number of subjects (inclusion of samples from Dijon CHU and Besan√ßon CHU)

study_pop.textblock: Blood samples used for this study come from a collection being created as part of the research entitled "The combined determination STREM-1/PCT/CD64 it allows the diagnosis of sepsis in intensive care" - No. IDRCB 2009 - A00870-57 and led by Professor Sebastian GIBOT CHU Nancy.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients hospitalised in a Medical Intensive Care unit whatever the reason
- written informed consent obtained
Exclusion Criteria:
- patients less than 18 years old or under guardianship, persons without national health insurance.
